DataElement.preferredName: Patient Metastatic Disease Enrollment Present Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to a patient and the abnormal condition regarding spread of cancer from the primary site to other places in the body at the time of enrollment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a patient and the abnormal condition regarding spread of cancer from the primary site to other places in the body at the time of enrollment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Metastatic Disease or Disorder Enrollment Present
Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have metastatic
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease at study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have non-contiguous metastatic disease at diagnosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant disease that is metastatic outside of the supratentorial region?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text _1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have definitive radiologic evidence of metastatic disease outside of the pelvic nodes on conventional imaging?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text _3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have definitive radiologic evidence of metastatic disease on conventional imaging defined by osseous metastasis on 99mTc bone scan, or extra pelvic nodal or soft tissue disease greater than 1.5 cm in short axis on CT or MRI pelvis and or abdomen

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text _2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have definitive radiologic evidence of metastatic disease (besides pelvic nodes) on conventional imaging defined by osseous metastasis on 99mTc bone scan,  or extra pelvic nodal or soft tissue disease on CT or MRI pelvis and or abdomen

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have evidence of extrapulmonary metastatic disease?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of extrapulmonary metastatic disease?
